conclusion: The coil is a square with side length L and N turns, rotating with angular velocity ω about an axis perpendicular to a uniform magnetic field B.
The axis is coplanar with the coil and the ab side is L/4 from the axis.
The magnetic flux through the coil is Φ = B ⋅ A ⋅ cos(θ), where A = L² is the area of the coil and θ is the angle between the normal to the coil and the magnetic field.
The induced EMF is given by 𝓔 = -N dΦ/dt.
Since the coil rotates with angular velocity ω, θ = ωt, therefore Φ = B L² cos(ωt).
Differentiating flux with respect to time, dΦ/dt = -B L² ω sin(ωt).
The induced EMF is then 𝓔 = N B L² ω sin(ωt).
The maximum value of 𝓔 occurs when sin(ωt) = 1, so 𝓔_max = N B L² ω.
The effective (rms) value of the EMF is given by 𝓔_rms = 𝓔_max/√2.
Substituting 𝓔_max, we get 𝓔_rms = (N B L² ω)/√2.
